content: The "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" is the short title of this Act. The Denali Commission has authorities and duties outlined in the Act. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to limit the status of Commission members as federal employees, except for the Federal Cochairperson. The Commission is also granted the authority to accept and utilize matching funds from public and private sources for projects. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to allow the Commission to accept matching funds for approved projects from public and private sources. The Denali Commission, under Section 307 of the Denali Commission Act of 1998, is authorized to receive lump sum payments from the Secretary of Labor for a training program focused on careers related to infrastructure development in rural Alaska, with a priority on construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects. Amounts made available to the Commission under this program remain available until expended. Additionally, the Commission is required to provide teacher housing in carrying out its functions. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 authorizes the Commission to provide assistance for teacher housing in rural Alaska, including activities like housing development such as acquisition, rehabilitation, new construction, and multisite rehabilitation. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date of the amendments is upon enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
